text: La Neuveville District was one of three French-speaking districts of the Bernese Jura in the canton of Bern with the seat being La Neuveville, the other two being Courtelary and Moutier. It had a population of about 6,083 in 2004. The three districts were merged on 1 January 2010 to form the new district of Jura Bernois with the capital at Courtelary.Nomenklaturen – Amtliches Gemeindeverzeichnis der Schweiz accessed 4 April 2011 {| cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" border="1" style="border: gray solid 1px; border-collapse: collapse;" !colspan="1" bgcolor="#BEBEBE" width="180" | Municipalities !colspan="1" bgcolor="#BEBEBE" width="140" | Population (2007)Swiss Federal Statistical Office accessed 08-Jul-2009 !colspan="1" bgcolor="#BEBEBE" width="100" | Area (km²) |- | Diesse || align="center" | 421 || align="center" | 9.44 |- | Lamboing || align="center" | 668 || align="center" | 9.10 |- | La Neuveville || align="center" | 3457 || align="center" | 6.80 |- | Nods BE || align="center" | 727 || align="center" | 26.70 |- | Prêles || align="center" | 867 || align="center" | 6.98 |} == References == Category:Former districts of the canton of Bern
